|rad1chip2 = Atheros;AR5133; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 2.4 or 5 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== [http://www.vonwentzel.net/ABS/Dissection-Extreme-n/index.html The Airport Extreme, version n, dissected] (noice internal shots)
[http://www.vonwentzel.net/ABS/Evolution/index.html Evolution of the ABS] Manufactured by Foxconn (internal part U01H335 / U01H335T01) [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AirPort AirPort devices on Wikipedia]
[http://www.amazon.com/Apple-MA073LL-AirPort-Extreme-Station/dp/B000MP831G On Amazon.com] (reviews) The device uses three antennas. The MIMO configuration is assumed to be 3x3. The Mini PCI card is part AR5BMB-0072TA (MB72). The FCC photos show the card labeled with a MAC starting with 00:16:CB. A [http://web.archive.org/web/20070217000047/http://www.ifixit.com/Guide/Mac/Airport-Extreme-802-11n/Disassembly-Page-1-Disassembly teardown of the device was previously featured on iFixit] (linked from [https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=9389 here]), pictures recovered by archive.org are linked below.. *[http://web.archive.org/web/20070217000219/http://www.ifixit.com/Guide/200/images_large/airport_logic_top.jpg High-res board top] *[http://web.archive.org/web/20070216235926/http://www.ifixit.com/Guide/200/images_large/airport_logic_bottom.jpg High-res board bottom] [[Category:English Documentation]]
